issue.title: Project: Implement time series models usable in Pyro

milestone.title: Initial release
milestone.description: Working implementations of the examples in the design doc as well as any necessary infrastructure

issue.body:
This issue plans PRs required to implement Bayesian filtering models in funsor that can then be used within Pyro models. We'd like to include a number of these in the initial release.

## Low level algorithms and math
- [x] #161  Implement `sequential_sum_product()` for discrete HMMs
- [x] #176 Implement `sequential_sum_product()` for Gaussian HMMs
- [x] #183 Support multiple variables in `sequential_sum_product()`
- [x] #173 Support multivariate linear pattern matching for linear-Gaussian filtering
- [x] #178 Implement partial substitution of Gaussian funsors 
- [x] #186 #184 Support rank-deficient operands in Gaussians ops
- ~~Implement a "Gaussian GEMM" that avoids the broadcast-multiply-reduce pattern (see `pyro.ops.gaussian.gaussian_tensordot()` https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/1980)~~ moved to https://github.com/pyro-ppl/funsor/issues/238
- ~~#167 Implement a `markov_sum_product()` for structured HMMs with arbitrary time window~~

## High level components
- [x] #170 Implement a `FunsorDistribution` wrapper to embed funsor distributions in Pyro
- [x] #174 #175 Implement funsor-pyro conversion functions
- [x] #205 Promote `funsor.sum_product.Slice` from an ad-hoc function to a `Funsor`
- [x] #206 Implement `eager_cat` for `Tensor`, `Gaussian`, `Joint` (cross listed in #162)
- ~~#70 Add a `Markov` or `Convolve` funsor~~

## Models as distributions
- [x] #171 Implement `DiscreteHMM` as a `FunsorDistribution`
- [x] #179 Implement a `GaussianMRF`
- [x] #185 Implement a `GaussianHMM`
- ~~#182 Implement a `GaussianDiscreteMRF`~~
- ~~#180 Implement a switching linear dynamical system MRF~~
- [x]  #187 Implement a switching linear dynamical system HMM
- ~~Implement a Tensor Monte Carlo smoothing `FunsorDistribution`~~

body:
> can you confirm

Yep, this should work as expected.

issue.title: Implement eager contract (Tensor,Tensor) via einsum
issue.body:
Addresses #238
Blocked by https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/2065

This implements `Contraction(-,-,-, Tensor, Tensor)` via `einsum`, using either the `torch` or `pyro.ops.einsum.torch_log` backend.

This also starts to use `Contraction()` inside `sequential_sum_product()` so as to make this cheaper op available under the eager interpretation.

## Tested
- refactoring is exercised by existing tests
- added a unit test

issue.title: Gaussian funsor variable elimination
issue.body:
Addresses https://github.com/pyro-ppl/pyro/pull/2929
See [design doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MVfG0po7M5UB2mNM2In6iKKq_OYNpa_I-FnJncUgXPI)

This issue tracks changes needed to efficiently perform variable elimination in Gaussian graphical models with plates. While `funsor.sum_product.sum_product()` is a partial solution, we'd like to generalize to a complete solution.

## Tasks
- [x] Introduce a new Funsor `ConditionalGaussian(info_vec, precision, conditional, inputs)` representing the batched conditional distribution of the rightmost real input variable, conditioned on other real input variables. This could be (i) a new Funsor in addition to `Gaussian`, (ii) a replacement or generalization of `Gaussian`, or (iii) a special case of `Gaussian` where the input `info_vec` and `precision` are structured (requires #556). This may allow cheaper linear algebra.

    Alternatively #567 
    **Temporary Workaround:** naively scatter the three parameters `(info_vec, precision, conditional)` into a dense `Gaussian`.  This can be much more computationally expensive.
- [ ] Handle collider variables where a latent variable outside a plate depends on an upstream latent variable inside a plate, thereby coupling the upstream variables via moralization. Currently such problems cannot even be specified in the plated-einsum DSL.
    **Temporary workaround:** Globally break all plates out of which any arrow leads; equivalent to `.to_event()`.
- [ ] Handle complete bipartite graphs resulting from the RBM motif (`x_i --> y_ij <-- z_j`). Currently `sum_product()` and the TVE algorithm give up in this case with "intractable!".
    **Temporary workaround:** no known workaround
